G

getAddress() - Method in interface il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg.Messenger
 
getNextMessage(long) - Method in interface il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg.Messenger
Returns the next received message.

I

il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg - package il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg
 

K

kill() - Method in interface il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg.Messenger
Stops the messenger; Killed messengers cannot accept new messages, but it is possible to create a new messenger with the same address as a killed messenger.

M

Messenger - Interface in il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg
Allows passing messages between two different, possibly distributed, java applications.
MessengerException - Exception in il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg
A wrapper of exceptions thrown by the underlying messaging mechanism

sends a message to another messenger.
start(String, Consumer<String>) - Method in class il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg.MessengerFactory
Creates a new messenger and starts it

Creates a new messenger and starts it

W

waitForMessage() - Method in interface il.ac.technion.cs.sd.msg.Messenger
Deprecated.
Relatively rare threading issues can cause uses to block indefinitely. For example, it is possible that the received message will be consumed before this method is called.
If you wish to block until a message is received, it is best to use the consumer to funnel the messages to a BlockingQueue and wait on that (e.g., using Queue.poll() or BlockingQueue.poll(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)). You can also use getNextMessage(long)
